statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Saint Joseph's 75, Charlotte 70
article.story: CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) -- Ahmad Nivins scored 11 of his 18 points in the second half Sunday and Saint Joseph's rallied to beat Charlotte 75-70. Darrin Govens and Pat Calathes added 14 points apiece for the Hawks, who overcame 27 points from Charlotte's De'Angelo Alexander to win their third straight game. Saint Joseph's (9-5, 2-0 Atlantic 10) trailed by 13 in the first half and 11 early in the second before Nivins went to work inside. He scored seven points in an 11-2 run that gave the Hawks their first lead with 5:47 left. Nivins' two free throws with 3 minutes left made it 66-63 and Rivera's layup with just over 2 minutes left gave the Hawks a 70-65 lead. After Alexander's driving layup with a minute left cut Charlotte's deficit to three at 70-67, Calathes hit a jumper with 34 seconds left then made two free throws with 10 seconds remaining to put it away for Saint Joseph's, which shot 64 percent in the second half. Alexander hit 8-of-16 shots and 7-of-8 free throws, but got little help when it mattered. Leemire Goldwire scored 20 points, but shot 2-for-7 in the second half as the 49ers (6-8, 0-2) lost their second straight game, both after giving up big leads. Charlotte led Dayton by nine points with under eight minutes left in a 66-63 loss on Thursday. The Hawks, who shot 56 percent in a 48-point win over Duquesne Wednesday, missed their first 10 shots against Charlotte. Govens' driving layup with 12:11 left ended the drought. Goldwire's 3-pointer with 5:07 left pushed the 49ers' lead to 29-16. Saint Joseph's cut its deficit to 36-27 at halftime despite hitting 8 of 25 shots, thanks to its rebounding. The Hawks held a 37-25 advantage on the glass and had 15 offensive rebounds. Rob Ferguson had eight points and six rebounds for Saint Joseph's despite playing on a sprained ankle suffered in practice Friday. Charlotte forward Antwon Coleman returned after missing Thursday's game with bronchitis, but appeared weak and didn't have a point or rebound in 10 minutes as the 49ers dropped to 4-2 at home.
